subject: RE: [junit] fileset wildcard question
msgSnippet:
You have haltonfailure=true, which means the ant task will grind to a halt as soon as any error occurs.

The batch test above seems to include only files that
messageBody:
You have haltonfailure=true, which means the ant task will grind to a halt as soon as any error occurs.

The batch test above seems to include only files that end in Test in the working directory:

<fileset dir="build/test" includes="*Test.class" />

However, the test below that is failing includes every file that ends in Test in the working directory AND every subdirectory (that's the "**/" prefix -- check out the Ant documentation on filesets.)

<fileset dir="build/test" includes="**/*Test.class" />

It looks like the second version runs tests that the first version isn't running - and those extra tests are failing. Do you recognize the test "sipenum.NAPTRTest" that is failing?


Daniel Wellman
U.S. Trust
Ph: (201) 533-6157
-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of vpham2000
Sent: Wednesday, July 27, 2005 12:39 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] fileset wildcard question

junit and ant newbie question, please help

what is the difference between
**/*Test.class vs *Test.class

I name my test cases with the word Test
at the end like OneTest.java, TwoTest.java etc ...

when I run batchtest like this, it works

  <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests">
    <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="true">
      <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
      <formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
      <batchtest fork="yes">
        <fileset dir="build/test" includes="*Test.class" />
      </batchtest>
    </junit>
     <echo>runtests complete!</echo>
  </target>

when I run batchtest like this, it does not work

  <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests">
    <junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="true">
      <classpath refid="project.classpath" />
      <formatter type="brief" usefile="false" />
      <batchtest fork="yes">
        <fileset dir="build/test" includes="**/*Test.class" />
      </batchtest>
    </junit>
     <echo>runtests complete!</echo>
  </target>

  and it gave me these errors

BUILD FAILED
